catalyst.context: The highly efficient spatial carrier separation and abundant active sites are significant for CO 2 photocatalytic reduction efficiency.Herein, an ultrathin Bi 2 O 3 nanosheet/Bi 2 WO 6 network heterostructure is successfully synthesized via a covalently bonded epitaxial growth strategy.Due to cosharing of the Bi-O tetrahedron between Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 , this heterostructure exhibits a compact interface, which can provide a highway for the charge transfer and then boost their separation.Moreover, the pores generated from the hierarchical structure afford abundant exposed photocatalytic active sites.Thus, the optimal Bi 2 O 3 /Bi 2 WO 6 heterostructure (BOBWO-12) shows superior photocatalytic performance for CO 2 reduction with an ultrahigh selectivity as well as the removal of RhB.Notably, the photocatalytic CO generation rate over BOBWO-12 reaches up to 17.39 molg -1 h -1 , which is 18.0 and 4.2 times higher than that of bulk-Bi 2 WO 6 and Bi 2 WO 6 nanosheets, respectively, and the selectivity is of about 95.4.Moreover, the Bi 2 O 3 /Bi 2 WO 6 heterostructure also exhibits improved long-term stability, resulting from the firm heterointerface.Our studies present a conventient avenue to construct a high-efficiency heterostructure photocatalyst with a firm interface by the covalently bonded epitaxial growth method for CO 2 reduction.

of Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 require to be investigated.To pinpoint the band position of Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 , the Mott-Schottky (MS) measurements were taken.The flat band potentials (E f ) of Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 are estimated to be -0.69 and -1.09V vs Ag/AgCl from the MS plot (Figure S5), which are equal to -0.07 and -0.47 V vs normal hydrogen electrode ACS Applied Energy Materials (NHE). 48The slopes of Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 MS plots are positive, indicating that Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 are n-type semiconductors. 49In n-type semiconductors, the flat-band potential is an approximation of the potential of the CB. 49herefore, the CB edge potentials of Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 are estimated to be -0.07 and -0.47 V (vs NHE, pH 0), respectively.Especially, the CB edge potentials of Bi 2 O 3 is more positive than the position (-0.11V vs. NHE, pH0) of CO 2 /CO photoreduction, thus the Bi 2 O 3 could not favor the CO 2 photoreduction to CO, which is consistent with the result of CO 2 photoreduction measurement (Figure 5a).Especially, the CB edge potential of Bi 2 O 3 is more positive than the position (-0.11V vs NHE, pH 0) of CO 2 /CO photoreduction; thus, Bi 2 O 3 could not favor the photoreduction of CO 2 to CO, which is consistent with the result of CO 2 photoreduction measurement (Figure 5a).Considering the Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 band gaps (E g ) to be 2.97 and 2.69 eV, the VB edge potentials of Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 are calculated to be 2.90 and 2.22 V, respectively.Therefore, the charge transfer mechanism could be divided into two types, II-type and Zscheme.If the II-type charge transfer mechanism is adopted in BOBWO, the electrons will transfer from CB of Bi 2 WO 6 to CB of Bi 2 O 3 and the holes will transfer from VB of Bi 2 O 3 to VB of Bi 2 WO 6 , which could not reach to the standard potential of CO 2 /CO photoreduction.However, the BOBWO-12 performs superior activity in CO 2 photoreduction to CO, which could be attributed to the Z-scheme charge transfer (Figure 6a).As we know, the photogenerated electrons of Aurivillius phase oxides Bi 2 WO 6 tend to transfer from BiO layer to WO 4 2layer 30 , and the photogenerated holes tend to transfer from BiO layer to WO 4 2-layer.Therefore, with the accumulated holes of Bi 2 WO 6 in BiO layer, the BiO layer of Bi 2 WO 6 can attract large photogenerated electrons from the Bi 2 O 3 , and the photogenerated electrons that arisen from Bi 2 O 3 could transfer to BiO layer of Bi 2 WO 6 by cosharing the Bi-O tetrahedron, eventually transfer to the WO4 2- layer (Figure 6b).Meanwhile, the cosharing of the Bi-O tetrahedron could shorten the migration distance of photogenerated carriers and accelerate the electron transfer (Figure 6c), which further explains the rapid photogenerated carrier transfer and the low photogenerated carrier recombination.Interestingly, taking the energy band structure, different interlayer structures, and atom structure into consideration, the photogenerated electrons all tend to transfer from Bi 2 O 3 to Bi 2 WO 6 , and the photogenerated holes all locate in Bi 2 O 3 and Bi 2 WO 6 , respectively, which also sufficiently proves the Zscheme charge transfer mechanism in the BOBWO. (Sigma Chemical Co.) in water or methanol were examined on a Bruker model ESR JES-FA200 spectrometer. 2.4.Photocatalytic Activity Tests.Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction tests: The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction tests were carried out under the irradiation of a solar simulator in a 300 mL home-made Pyrex glass reactor.In brief, 50 mg of sample was added into moderate DI water and dispersed evenly and then dried at 80 C.NaHCO 3 (0.084 g) was added to the groove in the reactor.Nitrogen (5 mL/min) was passed through liquid water to ensure the presence of saturated water vapor under atmospheric pressure.After purifying nitrogen for 20 min, 0.6 mL of H 2 SO 4 (2 molL -1 ) aqueous solution was injected slowly to react with NaHCO 3 to produce CO 2 and H 2 O vapor.Then, the reactor was irradiated under a 300 W Xe lamp with a cutoff filter ( 400 nm).The gas products were detected by a gas chromatograph (CEAULIGHT GC-7920) and calibrated with a standard gas mixture.All the gas components were determined by the retention time, and the concentrations of gas components were calculated by the external standard method of peak areas.
